si.t: Uses of the system that are subject to a legal restriction, list them here and the likelihood that the system would not meet requirements.
Potential uses for which the system was not designed or evaluated or that should be avoided, list them here and the likelihood that this usecase would occur.
Sensitive Uses – Consequential impact on legal position or life opportunities

Scenarios where the use or misuse of the AI system could affect an individual’s: legal status, legal rights, access to credit, education, employment, healthcare, housing, insurance, and social welfare benefits, services, or opportunities, or the terms on which they are provided.
Sensitive Uses – Risk of physical or psychological injury
Scenarios where the use or misuse of the AI system could result in significant physical or psychological injury to an individual.

Scenarios where the use or misuse of the AI system could restrict, infringe upon, or undermine the ability to realize an individual’s human rights. (Note: because human rights are interdependent and interrelated, AI can affect nearly every internationally recognized human right.)
Describe the known limitations of the system. This could include scenarios where the system will not perform well, environmental factors to consider, or other operating factors to be aware of.
Managed by routine mitigation; covered in normal procedures
Meets requirements; managed by routine mitigation; covered in normal procedures
May meet requirements; requires specific mitigation and caution
Unlikely to meet requirements; immediate action required

Describe regulatory requirements for the operating jurisdiction and consider the company's capacity for compliance.
This may include compliance with data protection and privacy regulations, such as GDPR and CCPA; liability and accountability for AI decisions and actions; intellectual property, including copyright and patent infringement risks.
Describe any industry-specific regulatory considerations where the AI technology is being applied and consider the company's capacity for compliance with industry-specific regulations, e.g. HIPAA.
Mitigating measures for how the company will comply with regulation (if any)
Mitigating measures for impact of non-compliance (if any)
No or insignificant risk to assets and personnel, and/or low negative impact on stakeholders or company
Somewhat insignificant risk to assets and personnel, and/or some negative impact on stakeholders or company
Meaningful risk to assets and personnel, and/or negative impact on stakeholders or company
Life threatening risk and/or critical negative impact on stakeholders or company
No or insignificant risk to assets and personnel, and/or low negative impact on company
Somewhat insignificant risk to assets and personnel, and/or some negative impact on company
Meaningful risk to assets and personnel, and/or negative impact on company
Life threatening risk and/or critical negative impact on company

Describe risks associated with the data requirements with respect to the system’s intended uses, stakeholders, and the geographic areas where the system will be deployed. (Note: omit regulatory consideration and include on the "Industry-Specific and Regulatory" tab.)
Models & infrastructure – Energy and environmental considerations

r.t: Describe technology readiness – the likelihood the system is
been deployed to production systems at scale for similar uses and the associated impact on users and stakeholders.
Describe the task complexity – the likelihood that there will be a
and complexity in setting boundaries for classification categories, etc. and the associated impact on users and stakeholders.

si.t: Describe the likelihood for large energy consumption and other considerations focused on environmental impacts linked to model training and inference and the associated impact at large.
Describe any additional potential risks pertaining to specifically to third party auditability of systems and models and community inclusion.
Describe any risks or vulnerability associated with scaling, adapting, and maintaining the technology including existential risk as a product of scale and its impact at large.
Relationships – Supply chain, customers, and partnerships
Describe vulnerabilities associated with the company's relationships including supply chain, customers, vendors, and strategic partnerships.

Describe vulnerabilities associated with the company's management team including track record, diversity in skillsets, as well as considerations for diversity, equity, and inclusion, and codifying decision-making processes.
